Conversion from VSS to StarTeam

Wrapping a StarTeam project around a VSS project makes it possible to use either StarTeam or VSS to access the files in the wrapped project.

On the Windows client, after the wrapping process is complete, you can permanently convert the VSS project to StarTeam. After the project has been converted, changes to the files will be reflected in StarTeam only, and you can delete the VSS database files.

Before you begin the conversion procedure:

  • Press F6 (foreign refresh; available only in the Windows client) until all the folders and files available in VSS are also available in StarTeam. This ensures that no new VSS subprojects, branches, or shared files are missed by the conversion process.

  • Make sure that all users are logged off the StarTeam and VSS projects.

This procedure converts the folders and files currently in the StarTeam folder hierarchy for the VSS project into StarTeam storage types. Depending upon the size of the VSS project, conversion may be time consuming. However, you can interrupt the procedure at any time and restore the files to their original VSS format.

Note: The Cross-Platform client supports projects based on foreign archives, such as VSS, but cannot convert them to StarTeam.

To convert an interoperable project to StarTeam storage (Windows client only):

  1. From StarTeam, select Project > Open, select a server from the left pane, and open the interoperable project.

  2. Select Tools > Convert to Native Format from the menu bar. A message asks you to verify the conversion of the files in this project to the StarTeam storage type.

  3. Click OK. The Converting Foreign Archives dialog opens, and the conversion process begins.

    4. If e-mail is enabled in StarTeam, the application will send you (the logged-on user) an e-mail when the process completes. Depending on the number and size of the archives being converted, the process may take some time.

    A GoNative log file provides even more data about the conversion. It is stored in repositoryFolder\Logs\Files_Logs where repositoryFolder is the location set for the server configuration's repository. The log file has the name GoNative.locale.log.

Caution: VSS projects and folders can be archived. However, if you archive VSS data and delete it from the repository, wrapping, operations and conversions from VSS to native StarTeam format may fail because of problems with the SSAPI.DLL file in your release of VSS. If your version of VSS is later than version 6, you must (1) locate a copy of version 6 (or earlier), (2) rename your SSAPI.DLL to SSAPIversionX.DLL so that you do not overwrite it, (3) copy the SSAPI.DLL from version 6 to your VSS installation, and (4) register it on Windows using regsrv32. Do this on the same computer as StarTeam Server, then restart the Server.
